intro: Catopsis fulgens, commonly known as the golden moss, is a species of moss that belongs to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and vibrant green to golden-yellow coloration. The plant features slender, branching stems covered with small, overlapping leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Catopsis fulgens thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or on rock surfaces. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores for dispersal.
